intro: Formanodendron doichangensis, commonly known as the Doichang daphne, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has simple, opposite leaves with a leathery texture and a distinct aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
